explanation: Agent A's report is not correct. The code as shown does not establish any direct or indirect recursion: metal_io_block_read calls a function pointer io->ops.block_read if present, but there is no assignment in the provided code that makes that pointer refer to metal_io_block_read. Moreover, the call uses a different parameter list (it passes memory_order_seq_cst as an extra argument), which indicates the ops.block_read pointer type is not the same as metal_io_block_read's type. Assigning metal_io_block_read to ops.block_read would therefore be a type mismatch (and would require an explicit cast) and is not present in the snippet. Without evidence in the program that ops.block_read can legitimately (and type-safely) be initialized to metal_io_block_read, you cannot conclude the function will indirectly call itself. (If a caller were to deliberately assign the pointer to the same function via an explicit cast, that would create recursion, but that is not shown here and would itself be poor/undefined practice.) Therefore the report of a MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 violation is not supported by the provided code.
